description: FLIF is an alternative to PNG, WebP, JPEG2000, JPEG-LS, lossless JPEG XR, MNG, APNG, GIF, and lossless BPG formats and boasts a better compression ratio. The format supports RGB, RGBA, and grayscale with a color depth of 1 to 16 bits per channel.
The FLIF format is made up of 4 parts:
More information about the format can be found here .
NOTE: The FLIF format was originally released in October of 2015 as an alpha release. The first stable version was released in September 2016.
